comment: both the minor and major severity strings will appear in conjunction with either a litter guess or an announcement. Write them accordingly!
They should also start with a space in order to ensure there is a space between the announcement/litter sentence and the severity sentence.

unmated_parent: m_c had a clutch but refused to talk about their origin.
m_c had a clutch with an unknown partner.
m_c had a clutch and refused to talk about their progenitor.
m_c had a clutch and is absolutely refusing to talk about it or acknowledge it at all.

m_c purrs sadly over the tiny eggs the stars has blessed {PRONOUN/m_c/object} with. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} is just glad to have this little piece of r_c
dragonets call out, but m_c can't be convinced to go back to the nursery. Not with the new eggs made from {PRONOUN/m_c/object} and r_c there, taunting m_c with what should have been.
Looking down at r_c's last gift to {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c vows to protect {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new clutch.

affair: m_c secretly had a clutch with r_c.

death: Later, as the cleric wails with m_c's blood streaked through their pelt and a warrior comes to move the body for the vigil, no one knows what to do with the eggs.

As the sun tracks across the sky, m_c's bleeding gets worse and worse. It was still worth it, m_c decides, even as the cleric fights an impossible battle to keep {PRONOUN/m_c/object} out of the stars. Still so worth it.
